page.title: 04Housewife Interview.
page.content: Mrs. M. has lived in the area for 15 years and believed Bury had not changed noticeably except for an increase in poplation. Mrs. M's childhood had been happy but she had not made full use of her opportunities at school. She thought that schools had become more informal than they were in the 1960's. She said that there were more subjects and better equipment nowadays. She thought more money needed to be spent to keep standards up. As Mrs. M. moved house several times she went to a number of different schools: Great Barstead Primary, Bagholt Primary, Lamarsh Primary, Bacton Modern and Gilbert County Technical. Mrs. M. now enjoys her life as a house wife as she has a lot af machines to help her around the house.
